basics.name: Riadh Fezzani
basics.label: Doctor in applied mathematics
basics.summary:
Autonomous and curious, 8 years of experience including a Ph.D., I appreciate multidisciplinary environments and the implementation of efficient algorithms.
I support open source projects and promote the [KISS principle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KISS_principle).

work.summary:
I actually work in the R&D departement of [**Océ - A Canon
                        compagny**](http://oce.com/), within the
                        [**Eiger
                        project**](http://www.projecteiger.com/)
                        (large format **2.5D** and **3D** high
                        resolution printing). My work consists in
                        developping multiple tools for the
                        visualization and the manipulation of digital
                        3D objects. During this mission, I
                        participated to the filling of three patents.

Within the [<abbr title="Systèmes d'Imagerie et Physique des
                        Images">SPIM</abbr>](https://www.lcf.institutoptique.fr/Groupes-de-recherche/SPIM)
                        team in the _laboratoire Charles Fabry_, I
                        worked in the context of the
                        [**Reveal**](http://www.agence-nationale-recherche.fr/?Project=ANR-12-TECS-0015)
                        project in close collaboration with the
                        **iMove** team at
                        [**ONERA**](http://www.onera.fr/), the
                        [**Institut de la
                        Vision**](http://www.institut-vision.org/en/)
                        and [**Imagine
                        Eyes**](http://www.imagine-eyes.com/) on the
                        design of efficient algorithms for the
                        processing of eye fundus images aquired with
                        an adaptive optics camera.

work.company:
<abbr title="Institut National de Recherche en Informatique et en
                        Automatique">INRIA</abbr>
work.summary:
Within the **PARALL** team in the [<abbr title="Laboratoire de
                        recherche en
                        informatique">LRI</abbr>](https://www.lri.fr/),
                        I worked in the context of the
                        [**PetalH**](http://petal.saclay.inria.fr/)
                        project on the design of new parallel
                        preconditioners made for the acceleration of
                        the resolution of large ill-conditioned sparse
                        linear systems.
highlights: Approximate block LDU factorization with filtering constraints

work.company:
<abbr title="Office Nationale d'Étude et de Recherches
Aérospatiales">ONERA</abbr>
work.summary:
In the hight performance computing team (<abbr title="Département du
						            Traitrement de l'Information et
						            Modélisation/ Calcul Haute
						            Performance">DTIM/CHP</abbr>), "Parallel
						            approach for optical flow estimation by
						            variational method" (Advisors: Frédéric
						            _Champagnat_ and François-Xavier _Roux_).

work.company:
<abbr title="Centre Européen de Recherche et de Formation Avancée en
                        Calcul Scientifique">CERFACS</abbr>
work.summary:
In the parallel algorithms team, in collaboration with [<abbr
                        title="The Innovative Computing
                        Laboratory">ICL</abbr>](http://www.icl.utk.edu/)
                        from the university of Tennessee: "Study of
                        the parallelization of the \\(LDL^T\\)
                        factorization in the symmetric indefinite
                        case" (Advisor: Marc _Baboulin_).
